title: BREAKING! SpaceX Sets Timeline For Inaugural Starship Flight
summary: SpaceX have confirmed they are preparing for the historic first flight of Starship.

title: NASA Administrator Names New Goddard Center Director
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson has named Dr. Makenzie Lystrup director of the agency’s Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland, effective immediately. She will make history as the first female center director at Goddard.

title: Investing in Space: Deloitte formalizes its space consulting business, with an eye on growth
summary: The space industry keeps growing, and global consulting groups aren’t ones to be left behind.

title: NASA Awards Innovative Concept Studies for Science, Exploration
summary: Technology in development today could radically change the future of air and space exploration. Nearly silent electric aircraft could ferry people and packages around cities, a sprawling radio telescope array on the far side of the Moon could reveal new secrets about the universe, and astronauts on long-duration missions could grow their own medici

title: NASA Sets Coverage for Air Quality Instrument Launch
summary: NASA and SpaceX are targeting no earlier than 12:30 a.m. EDT Friday, April 7, to launch NASA’s TEMPO (Tropospheric Emissions Monitoring of Pollution instrument). TEMPO is the first space-based instrument to monitor major air pollutants hourly in high spatial resolution – down to four square miles – in a region stretching from the Atlantic to the Pa

title: Startup aims to fill technology gaps in space warfare
summary: True Anomaly, formed a year ago to focus on the national security market, announced April 6 it has raised $30 million in pre-seed, seed, and Series A funding.

title: Loft Orbital orders 15 more buses from Airbus OneWeb Satellites
summary: Loft Orbital has ordered an additional 15 satellite buses from Airbus OneWeb Satellites to meet growing demand for its standardized space platforms.

title: China invites Venezuela to join moon base project
summary: China has invited Venezuela to join its lunar research station project as the country works to gain partners for the endeavor.

title: NASA Earth science hosted payload set for launch on Intelsat satellite
summary: The upcoming launch of a NASA Earth science instrument on a commercial communications satellite illustrates the promise of, but also the problems with, hosted payloads.

title: Space Development Agency’s first satellite launch hailed as model
summary: The successful launch of Tranche 0 satellites took place 27 months after SDA, an agency under the U.S. Space Force, ordered the satellites, drawing praise from senior officials.
